body_html:
1. Latest TensorFlow supports CUDA 8.0-10.0. CuDNN 6-7.
  2. Each TensorFlow binary has to work with the version of CUDA and CuDNN it was built with. If they don't match, you have to change either the TensorFlow binary or the Nvidia softwares.
  3. Official latest TensorFlow binaries (the one downloaded by pip or conda) are built with CUDA 9.0, CuDNN 7.
  4. If you don't like to change your Nvidia software, you can:
    (1) Use non-official binaries built by others. e.g.: https://github.com/mind/wheels/releases, https://github.com/hadim/docker-tensorflow-builder#builds
    (2) Build the binaries by yourself from source with your version of Nvidia software.
body_text:
Latest TensorFlow supports CUDA 8.0-10.0. CuDNN 6-7.
Each TensorFlow binary has to work with the version of CUDA and CuDNN it was built with. If they don't match, you have to change either the TensorFlow binary or the Nvidia softwares.
Official latest TensorFlow binaries (the one downloaded by pip or conda) are built with CUDA 9.0, CuDNN 7.
If you don't like to change your Nvidia software, you can:
(1) Use non-official binaries built by others. e.g.: https://github.com/mind/wheels/releases, https://github.com/hadim/docker-tensorflow-builder#builds
(2) Build the binaries by yourself from source  with your version of Nvidia software.
body:
1. Latest TensorFlow __supports__ CUDA 8.0-10.0. CuDNN 6-7.
2. Each TensorFlow binary has to work with the version of CUDA and CuDNN it was built with. If they don't match, you have to change either the TensorFlow binary or the Nvidia softwares.
3. Official latest TensorFlow binaries (the one downloaded by pip or conda) are built with CUDA 9.0, CuDNN 7.
4. If you don't like to change your Nvidia software, you can:
(1) Use non-official binaries built by others. e.g.: https://github.com/mind/wheels/releases, https://github.com/hadim/docker-tensorflow-builder#builds
(2) Build the binaries by yourself from source  with your version of Nvidia software.
